data.text:
Public health crises can worsen gender inequalities, resulting in devastating impacts on women and girls. 

@UNICEF explains how to ensure gender equality is at the centre of the world's #COVID19 response. https://t.co/rNx30wWBJf

As the world works to stop the spread of #COVID19, @WFP is drawing on lessons learned from its efforts to contain another public health emergency - the first major Ebola outbreak. https://t.co/7VnkaGDI12

The #COVID19 crisis is resulting in an increase in gender-based violence worldwide. 

@GlobalSpotlight is working to end violence against women & girls during the #coronavirus crisis and at all times. https://t.co/wyLkEsQH72 https://t.co/3KZi6H548Q

In response to #COVID19, @UNDP is showing solidarity with affected countries by working to strengthen health systems, improve livelihoods, promote community education & more. #coronavirus 

https://t.co/g3a5zQkcRP

Sunday is the first-ever International Day of Conscience. 

In the face of the #COVID19 crisis - and always - let's focus on promoting tolerance & solidarity and helping those in need. https://t.co/oiqkSVIY8H https://t.co/mmJePBxjUL

Around the world, the #COVID19 crisis has left many women facing increased risks of domestic violence.

Shelters, hotlines, online counseling and psycho-social support are needed now more than ever to support women & girls. https://t.co/ovYVWIBm0o via @UN_Women https://t.co/IFAKbTDgRY

"What the world needs now is solidarity. With solidarity we can defeat the virus and build a better world." -- @antonioguterres.

Get inspired by this @Twitter moment. https://t.co/RiWqEiMl6m

As the world is tackling #COVID19, there can be no delay in #ClimateAction.

See how @UNFCCC helps developing countries gain access to climate technologies - an investment in a healthy future. https://t.co/oOXRauOH7a https://t.co/cUtli7BSqm
https://t.co/lHoeKhgmtz

.@antonioguterres has appealed for an urgent global ceasefire amid the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Now @Avaaz is giving people around the world a chance to join his call for peace. 

Sign here and make your voice heard. 

https://t.co/P8r4J8zZj1

While all foods have some vitamins & minerals, colourful fruits & vegetables are especially good for you.  

More tips from @WFP on how to maintain a healthy diet in the face of #COVID19. https://t.co/ymCVkXBFuQ #UnitedWeEat https://t.co/1OsJyNEX7i

"We must see countries not only united to beat the virus but also to tackle its profound consequences." 

-- @antonioguterres at report launch on socio-economic impacts of #COVID19 this week. https://t.co/hQBvnvCytj https://t.co/aE8MxfmVbJ

The achievements of the mine action community show that, in working together, we can reach milestones once seen as impossible – a timely message for our efforts today against #COVID19.

-- @antonioguterres on Saturday's Mine Awareness Day. https://t.co/LsOH5TQJfU https://t.co/tVt6Au8dwv

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, UN Messengers of Peace add their voices to @antonioguterres’ call for a global ceasefire. https://t.co/o5IMalZGse

https://t.co/bkvifXLyjj

Whether at home or as first responders, women are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response around the world.

Learn about the unique needs of women during the #coronavirus pandemic, and how the UN is working to support them. 

https://t.co/wmeRvHR8aB

With school closures & cancelled events due to #COVI19, many teenagers are feeling isolated & like they are missing out on some of the biggest moments of their young lives.

@UNICEF has tips for teens & parents trying to adapt to these challenging times. https://t.co/iE9xG7ATog
Happy birthday to our Messenger of Peace Jane Goodall, and thank you for all your support! https://t.co/6OU6B8HySu

"We need to do everything possible to find the peace & unity our world so desperately needs to battle #COVID19. We must mobilize every ounce of energy to defeat it."

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/IQeeneOSAh #coronavirus https://t.co/a8cXgwbMgP

Watch live: update by @antonioguterres on the impact of his call for a global ceasefire amid the #COVID19 pandemic.

https://t.co/3PkuhDpMPU

Humanitarians are mobilized in solidarity with some of the world's most vulnerable people in the face of #COVID19. 

Here are just some of the ways the humanitarian system is responding 
 to #coronavirus. https://t.co/dygSoVzp6I

https://t.co/xHsrvJFIHb

#Coronavirus crisis poses serious social & economic threat to developing economies.

@UNDP is helping countries prepare, respond & recover from the #COVID19 pandemic, focusing particularly on the most vulnerable. https://t.co/ayLYbCe7Ok https://t.co/x7jQglVsOo

🤿 Fancy a virtual dive in the ocean 🐠?  

As many are forced to stay at home because of #COVID19, @UNEP is sharing online resources to learn more about coral reefs and oceans. 

https://t.co/8pkucbXJdx

Here's how the UN showed solidarity with people with autism - and everyone around the world facing #COVID19 - on Thursday's #WorldAutismAwarenessDay.

https://t.co/nS5iXupXsx
From @FIFAcom players to @WhatsApp, here are some of the ways the UN is working to share vital information about the #COVID19 crisis.  https://t.co/3AdCJwAQZl

The #COVID19 pandemic is a wake-up call for humanity. 

75% of emerging infectious diseases come from animals. To prevent further outbreaks, efforts must be made to stop illegal wildlife trade & destruction of habitats. https://t.co/0Ca3Olzpe2 via @UNEP 

https://t.co/8sdLGCxlft

"I'm profoundly grateful for the heroic efforts of all health workers on the front lines of the global fight against the #coronavirus."
-- @antonioguterres 

Amid the #COVID19 crisis, the UN is supporting front line responders around the world. https://t.co/RfqiCk2iS3 https://t.co/qKKvABGPr9

The UN system is fully mobilized, providing guidance, supporting country responses & placing our supply chains at the world’s disposal -- @antonioguterres.

See examples of the UN's efforts to tackle #COVID19 in this @Twitter moment.
https://t.co/chFqrYLOJS

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, the men & women of @UNPeacekeeping are continuing their vital work around the world, while also supporting critical mitigation efforts against the spread of #coronavirus. 

https://t.co/toYNfZVaiU

As people are asked to stay home to prevent the spread of #COVID19, many are looking for new ways to stay physically active.  

Ahead of the Int'l Sports Day for Development & Peace, see how to #BeActive amid the #coronavirus pandemic: https://t.co/LNtzTYIoup https://t.co/yzW5XBEzcy

From having all necessary prescriptions to ensuring you have contact details for your community support network, @UNAIDS has tips on how people living with HIV can prepare for #COVID19. https://t.co/aa3LKeKUFa https://t.co/5ozeUjem57

"We must ensure that a prolonged disruption caused by #COVID19 does not result in rollbacks of the rights of people with autism." 

-- @antonioguterres on Thursday's #WorldAutismAwarenessDay. https://t.co/rDnouDdLq3 https://t.co/3ozf1xSvOT

As @antonioguterres appeals for an urgent global ceasefire amid the #COVID19 pandemic, @Avaaz is giving people around the world a chance to add their voices to the worldwide call for peace.

https://t.co/P8r4J8inUr
With the threat of #COVID19 on the rise in Latin America, the UN is supporting countries in the region as they launch an urgent bid to slow the spread of the virus. https://t.co/Vb33GsSqwg

In support of the #coronavirus response, @iaeaorg has provided specialized testing equipment to 40+ countries to help speed-up the detection of #COVID19 cases. https://t.co/wxMbHmWAj2 https://t.co/Wml48aux4g

Global economy could shrink by almost 1% this year due to the #COVID19 pandemic. 

New @UNDESA report. https://t.co/BvBIfCwaP1 https://t.co/ZCF5muqncm

Less airline traffic due to #COVID19 has reduced the amount of in-flight measurements of temperature & wind.

@WMO is concerned about how the scaled-back and lower-quality data could impact weather observations, forecasts & extreme weather warnings. https://t.co/hSIfHe5Yp0 https://t.co/Qo23vpdIPa

With help from @Refugees, these women learned how to make soap for their families at the Za'atari refugee camp in Jordan.
They're now using those skills to support their community's efforts to stop the spread of #coronavirus.

 https://t.co/QvjkmGg53t

We need global solidarity and shared responsibility to effectively respond to  #coronavirus crisis, says new report on socio-economic impacts of #COVID19. https://t.co/hQBvnvkXBL https://t.co/dedgJcl5cn

The increasing threat posed by #COVID19, along with the risk of measles and cholera are putting children in the Democratic Republic of the Congo in a lot of danger. 

@UNICEF is working the support the country's fragile health system. https://t.co/PHns5T4Vr6

Wednesday: Dominican Republic takes on the rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of April. Follow @RDMISIONONU for updates. 
https://t.co/5EQUNWZPOV https://t.co/7rzREa5fhg
Amid the #COVID19 crisis, the UN is warning online users about a wave of misinformation related to #coronavirus - and the increasing threat posed by cyber crime: https://t.co/9epYdryjdS

Around the world, people & communities are coming together in an inspirational display of unity in the face of #COVID19. 

Check out this @Twitter moment to see great examples of solidarity in the time of crisis. 

https://t.co/mhIUZyiarQ

In times of #coronavirus, it is more important than ever to stay informed.

We are working to get you #COVID19 updates in many different ways, including on our new @tiktok_us account. Follow @unitednations and take the #SafeHands challenge. 👇

https://t.co/aeKepayfIw

"What the world needs now is solidarity. With solidarity we can defeat the virus and build a better world." 

-- @antonioguterres at report launch on socio-economic impacts of #COVID19. https://t.co/hQBvnvkXBL https://t.co/QumoKSDD97
Watch live as @antonioguterres launches report on the socio-economic impacts of #COVID19. https://t.co/XgNp16PjlK

Syria: As risk of #coronavirus spreads throughout country, @UNEnvoySyria appeals for a complete & immediate nationwide ceasefire to allow for an all-out-effort to fight #COVID19. https://t.co/0wsrzOrjZy

As more people are staying at home due to #COVID19, a surge in domestic violence has been reported across the world. 

@UNODC calls for urgent measures to curb escalation of gender-based violence through the course of the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/imRPfmyXY4 https://t.co/f2xUTW3wse

Medical workers & humanitarians are on the front lines of the #COVID19 response. 

@UNOCHA shares their stories of bravery & solidarity in the face of the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/vYxxHSmvn0

Handwashing is an important part of the response to the #COVID19 pandemic. 

🎧 Take a listen, as a @WHO expert explains why clean hands are so important and what long-term solutions are being explored. https://t.co/Tjlko2xWsn
Measures to support supply chains and global trade can help prevent food shortages & price increases as a result of the #COVID19 pandemic, says @FAO. https://t.co/7mpvpUjEqI https://t.co/wWxbVTrbKQ
As #COVID19 continues to spread, the UN and partners are working to help the African continent prepare for the impacts of #coronavirus. https://t.co/HW4Btfw4gA

As #COVID19 affects people around world the UN is working around the clock to tackle the #coronavirus and protect the most vulnerable. See some examples of our efforts in this @Twitter moment. https://t.co/vVOwyPxbsg

In light of the #coronavirus pandemic, there is evidence of increasing verbal & physical attacks against some minority groups. 

Fears over #COVID19 are no excuse to exploit, attack or exclude minorities, stress @UNHumanRights experts. https://t.co/Mzs83KkY3T #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/5HkMTkKxkj

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, @UNCTAD urgently calls for a $2.5 trillion #coronavirus aid package to help developing countries avoid worst-case scenarios. https://t.co/OMVDkWZRMM https://t.co/2Y1nld0bHr

#COVID19 is NOT airborne & is mainly transmitted from droplets generated when an infected person coughs, sneezes or speaks.

More from @WHO on protecting yourself from #coronavirus: https://t.co/FU7mXKXzGg https://t.co/HJprzITU0R

Displaced people & host communities are at serious risk as #COVID19 spreads.

Here's how @Refugees is working to protect those forced to flee amid the the global #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/BkgwOl27Ss

The survival of great apes is threatened by habitat loss, illegal hunting & other risks.

As #COVID19 impacts human well-being around the world, @UNEP explores the new risks now faced by apes in danger of contracting the virus. https://t.co/dABntgU5Zh

87% of the world’s student population is affected by school closures due to #COVID19.

@UNESCO has online educational tools & resources to help ensure #LearningNeverStops, despite the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/sn2dJQVdlt https://t.co/3CTbHwvFPb

Globally, 70% of people working in health care and social services are women.

Paying attention to women’s needs & leadership will strengthen the #COVID19 response. https://t.co/ovYVWIBm0o via @UN_Women https://t.co/8fCpMHAgpc

#COVID19 is menacing the whole of humanity – and so the whole of humanity must fight back.

-- @antonioguterres at launch of Global Humanitarian Response Plan for  #coronavirus this week. https://t.co/vusV9bESKk https://t.co/aEi1QK4pnh

From support for the most vulnerable to international cooperation, the global experience with the HIV epidemic could help inform an effective, community-led response to #COVID19.  https://t.co/bF8R8kSuaT via @UNAIDS https://t.co/2fQ5eBDKyp

I'm profoundly grateful for the heroic efforts of all health workers on the front lines of the global fight against the #coronavirus.

We must ensure they receive the support they need to continue carrying out their critical work.
-@antonioguterres #COVID19 https://t.co/DJsc15Z1Di
In the face of the global #COVID19 pandemic, the UN is working to support frontline responders, governments and the most vulnerable. https://t.co/3Dt6v31zAG

People all over the world can now get real-time, accurate information about #COVID19 directly from @WHO through @Whatsapp. 

Here's how: https://t.co/Usb6myHkeC https://t.co/C0JRjSFrUG

Indigenous peoples are at disproportionate risk in public health emergencies such as #COVID19.

Follow @UN4Indigenous for updates on the #coronavirus crisis and its impact on indigenous communities. https://t.co/BbVZ4ubnay https://t.co/oh53HtkPHM

The elderly & people with pre-existing health conditions are more susceptible to #COVID19. To stay safe, they should:
✔️ Keep distance from people who are sick
✔️ Frequently wash hands with soap & water
✔️ Protect their mental health

More tips from @WHO: https://t.co/IiaPWjzAwg https://t.co/Si6aYOtRaz

Coronaviruses, such as #COVID19, are zoonotic, meaning they are transmitted from animals to humans.

Such illnesses threaten the well-being of humans, animals and ecosystems, while also putting economic development at risk. https://t.co/T4C9sVGeFd - via @UNEP #coronavirus https://t.co/p9Ld6qLHCr

👩🏼‍⚕️ Midwives
👩🏽‍⚕️ Nurses
👩🏻‍⚕️ Community health workers

Women are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response around the world. 

More from @UNFPA: https://t.co/n0RBtR1bro https://t.co/tp877bdbNK

"Silence the guns; stop the artillery; end the airstrikes."

-- @antonioguterres calls for a global ceasefire amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/4OzjT0E69p https://t.co/K0jUVefWKb

From refugees volunteering their time to grandmas making masks for healthcare workers - people around the world are coming together in solidarity to tackle the #COVID19 crisis. 
https://t.co/IgRvuKdHwF

With the #COVID19 pandemic extending to some of the world’s most vulnerable countries, the UN is working to support frontline responders & help strengthen weakened health infrastructure. https://t.co/uNTYwXteaN

"As much as the pandemic poses a global threat to peace & security, it also presents an opportunity to demonstrate unity & join hands."

-- @UNAOC & @UN_GP_RtoP chiefs' call for solidarity, compassion & unity during the #COVID19 crisis.
https://t.co/64m0DQVvgN

87% of the world’s students are affected by school closures due to #COVID19.

@UNESCO's global education coalition supports countries as they scale-up their distance learning efforts and try to help children & youth most at risk. https://t.co/Ta8I3FjeRA https://t.co/zP8S5qrxUn

During Saturday's #EarthHour at 8.30pm wherever you are, take a moment to honour those at the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Let’s take care of ourselves, each other, and the planet. https://t.co/tFTOszOwdq https://t.co/7GFw7GPYPN

Today’s threats – from #COVID19 to climate change – are global and must be addressed through multilateral cooperation.

That is what the UN continues to offer, even, and especially, in these trying times.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/TSV0CWrYkA #coronavirus https://t.co/qHLEJGrWH9

Refugees can & must be included in national #COVID19 surveillance, preparedness and response activities.

@Refugees is working around the world to protect the displaced who are least able to protect themselves from #coronavirus. https://t.co/4HTJffh3js https://t.co/mfiK3FaIQJ

As #COVID19 forces more schools to close, @WFP has created a real-time map to track how many children are missing out on school meals. 

Efforts to ensure students continue receiving support amid the #coronavirus crisis continue around the world. https://t.co/dKTDxFvPCA https://t.co/xSqf0VFA24

🤸‍ Try online exercise classes 
💃 Dance to music
🤾 Skip rope

@WHO has more tips on how to #BeActive and stay #HealthyAtHome during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/Xdrfo5uF5M https://t.co/9MrqAUQWpJ

"It is shameful to see increasing acts of racial discrimination and prejudice as we fight the #COVID19 pandemic - a crisis that affects us all."

-- @antonioguterres on the need for unity and respect amid the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/2zxrPa1MMY https://t.co/IhcWLinTGi

While there are no specific foods that prevent #COVID19, a healthy diet can help promote a stronger immune system and protect your body against illness.

@WFP has 7 tips for eating well in the face of #coronavirus. https://t.co/LOc1NIdDT6

Amid #COVID19, people are being asked to socially distance themselves, or in some cases, are under mandatory lockdown.

From telecommuting to distance learning, here are tips for how to stay safe & show solidarity, while maintaining a sense of normalcy. https://t.co/W23VNYTCBn

While the #coronavirus is affecting all areas of life, the UN is working around the world to tackle #COVID19 and protect the most vulnerable. See some examples of our efforts in this @Twitter moment. https://t.co/d1Ar0cDm2z
As #COVID19 forces school closures around the world, @UNICEF scales-up support in 145 countries to help children continue learning. #coronavirus https://t.co/BIcQwZyvjF

People around the world are uniting in the face of the #COVID19 pandemic.
See how a group of Syrian refugees in Switzerland are showing solidarity to help protect elderly residents in their community. https://t.co/tlzZs1jRgG - via @Refugees 

https://t.co/8ZhwPHd1m0

This humanitarian response plan is a necessity for global health security. It is a moral imperative & in everyone’s interests. And it is a crucial part of winning this fight.

-- @antonioguterres at launch of Global Humanitarian Response Plan for #COVID19. https://t.co/vusV9bnhSM https://t.co/v3yDSjuyRH

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable. 

Take @UNICEF's #coronavirus quiz to check if you have the facts needed to protect yourself and those around you.
https://t.co/HedH12d6iV

We must come to the aid of the ultra-vulnerable.

This is a matter of basic human solidarity.
It is also crucial for combatting the #coronavirus.

-- @antonioguterres at launch of Global Humanitarian Response Plan for #COVID19. https://t.co/vusV9bnhSM https://t.co/CPX9vYvfvD

As classes are cancelled due to #COVID19, @UNEP has ideas about how kids can make the most of their time at home, while learning how to take #ClimateAction and #BeatPlasticPollution.  https://t.co/2y9R3JEHi3

The UN is calling for increased funding & greater solidarity to support the world’s most vulnerable countries as they scale-up their efforts to combat the #coronavirus pandemic. #COVID19 https://t.co/XsEIFkjKfW

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, people around the world are showing support & solidarity to help others. See some acts of kindness in this @Twitter moment. #coronavirus.

https://t.co/Rnmhq1kk3E

.@UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet urges Governments to take urgent steps to prevent spread of #COVID19 among people being held in prisons, immigration detention centres & other closed facilities. https://t.co/eCyktueXvn #StandUp4HumanRights

 https://t.co/Vdr65rtzZE

#COVID19 is menacing the whole of humanity – and so the whole of humanity must fight back.

-- @antonioguterres at launch of Global Humanitarian Response Plan for  #coronavirus. https://t.co/vusV9bnhSM https://t.co/ftPtvRNI12

Solidarity and compassion are critical in the #COVID19 response. 

On Wednesday's #RememberSlavery Day - and every day - help #FightRacism, a shameful legacy of the transatlantic slave trade. https://t.co/8MmiNyKzya #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/ZdcDcs6u8l

Women are at the heart of the #COVID19 response efforts underway around the world. 

@UN_Women stresses the importance of maintaining a gender perspective in the global effort to combat #coronavirus. https://t.co/dM62vRHeu3

Many of our UN colleagues risk their lives every day, working on the front lines of conflicts & crisis, including the #COVID19 pandemic.

On Wednesday's Int'l Day & every day, we honour & stand in solidarity with our colleagues who are detained or missing. https://t.co/5nrXp4lofz https://t.co/lXg8qWbhsi

Wednesday is #RememberSlavery Day.

The transatlantic slave trade ended centuries ago, but its shameful legacy of racism persists. 

In the time of #COVID19 - and always - we must #FightRacism & take a stand against all forms of discrimination. https://t.co/8MmiNz2apI https://t.co/NSJwuQx87o

The most vulnerable — women & children, people with disabilities, the marginalized & the displaced — are at the highest risk of suffering devastating losses from the #coronavirus crisis.

The UN is working to protect them during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/52xfjjPmEL

I'm profoundly grateful for the heroic efforts of all health workers on the front lines of the global fight against the #coronavirus. 

We must ensure they receive the support they need to continue carrying out their critical work. 
- @antonioguterres #COVID19 https://t.co/9ikESKrdZ5

#COVID19 is affecting people all over the world. 

The UN is working around the clock to tackle the #coronavirus and protect the most vulnerable. See some examples of our efforts in this @Twitter moment.
https://t.co/2Ji2IVGUHY
